text: if there's something troubling us
particularly if it's something that
happened a while ago we haven't been
able to bounce back quite as much as
we'd wanted to kind of preys on us
then these simple writing exercises can
really help and one that was developed
by a social psychologist named James
Pennebaker involves taking out a piece
of paper usually before people go to bed
they do it they write for about 15
minutes about whatever it is that's
troubling them and they try to do so in
a way that they focus on all their
deepest feelings and thoughts about this
episode
sounds simple but it's not easy to do it
to really write about something negative
but if they can stick with it and do it
for two or three nights in a row it has
remarkable benefits and I think why is
the the people who benefit the most are
those who start out writing a kind of a
jumbled maybe not very coherent
description of whatever is troubling
them but by the end they found a new
narrative a new way of describing this
event that gives it more meaning perhaps
allows them to stop thinking about it so
much because they understand it better
their health afterwards their immune
systems and all of these things improve
as a result
